usefulItems: baking tray (30 x 40 cm), baking paper, tooth picks, bowl, refrigerator, freezer
title: Chocolate and prune Easter eggs

ingredients.content: 250 - 300 g dark chocolate, broken into pieces

preparations.content: Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place prunes into mixing bowl and chop <b>Turbo/1 sec/5-6 times<b>.

Using damp hands, take 1 teaspoon of prune mixture and form into a small egg shape and place onto prepared baking tray. Repeat with remaining prune mixture to form approx. 35-40 eggs. Insert a toothpick into the end of each egg. Transfer baking tray into freezer to set (approx. 30 minutes). Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl and chop <b>Turbo/1 sec/5-6 times<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then melt <b>2 min 30 sec/50°C/speed 1<b>. Transfer into a bowl.
With aid of toothpick, dip chilled prune eggs into melted chocolate.
Place coated eggs back onto baking tray, then place into freezer to allow chocolate to set (approx. 10 minutes).
Remove toothpicks, then serve immediately or transfer into a sealable container and place into refrigerator until ready to serve.

hintsAndTricks: To decorate your prune Easter eggs, pipe very thin lines of melted milk chocolate over dark chocolate coated prune eggs before returning to freezer in Step 7.
